item.description:
Hello! I am Kevin Kiley. I am currently a postdoctoral scholar at the University of Iowa’s Department of Sociology and Criminology. I received my Ph.D. in sociology in 2021 from Duke University. Here is my CV.

My dissertation research explores the cultural and cognitive sources of attitude and opinion stability and change over the life course and develops new methods for measuring opinion behavior over time. A central project from that work develops a cultural-cognitive theory of ambivalence and shows that ambivalence is an extremely common opinion behavior. To date, my work has appeared in the American Sociological Review and Sociological Science.

At the University of Iowa, I am working with Yongren Shi to employ diverse computational approaches to adjudicate different theories about how the cultures of online communities emerge and change.

If any of this interests you, please reach out: kevin-kiley@uiowa.edu.
